page.title: 02DAIRY FARMING. 1
page.content: Dairy Farming is very popular in Shropshire. The breed of cows most usually milked nowdays is the {Friesian. The cows are milked in parlours. Shippons, where each cow had its own stall, are almost non-existant. In parlours,the cowman stands in a pit in the centre and the cows come and stand each side of him, between five and twelve at a time. They are usually milked twice a day, sometimes three times. They graze the fields in summer, but in the winter are kept inside and fed winter fodder. This can be{silage,}made from grass or maize, hay or straw, with several different compounds fed to them as well. A tanker collects the milk from the farm's bulk milk tank once a day and takes it to the creamery. (continued on the next page)
